org.fcrepo.connector.fedora3.rest

Class RESTFedoraDatastreamRecordImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fcrepo.connector.fedora3.rest.RESTFedoraDatastreamRecordImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FedoraDatastreamRecord

    public class RESTFedoraDatastreamRecordImpl
extends Object
implements FedoraDatastreamRecord
    An implementation of FedoraDatastreamRecord that gets all of its information using the fedora 3 REST API.
    Author:
    Michael Durbin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected RESTFedoraDatastreamRecordImpl(com.yourmediashelf.fedora.client.FedoraClient fc, List<com.yourmediashelf.fedora.generated.management.DatastreamProfile> dsProfiles)
      This part of object construction is only separated into a protected constructor for unit testing as it allows mock DatastreamProfile objects to be provided and used (which allows most calls to be tested with a null FedoraClient.
        RESTFedoraDatastreamRecordImpl(com.yourmediashelf.fedora.client.FedoraClient fc, String pid, String dsid)
      A constructor that takes as a parameter the DatastreamType object that was returned by the FedoraClient as its source for information about the fedora 3 datastream to be described by this object.

      • getControlGroup

        public String getControlGroup()
        Get the control group for the datastream described by this record. This value, while significant in Fedora 3, is only present as an indicator of historic status, since storage management is handled through another mechanism in Fedora 4.
        Specified by:
        getControlGroup in interface FedoraDatastreamRecord

      • getState

        public String getState()
        Gets the state for the datastream described by this record.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface FedoraDatastreamRecord

      • getVersionable

        public boolean getVersionable()
        Gets the 'versionable' value for the datastream described by this record. This value does not imply anything about whether or how many versions of this datastream exists (there is always at least one) but instead was an indicator of whether an update to the described datastream in Fedora 3 would overwrite the current version or create a new one. In the context of fedora 4, this value is just to preserve the historical record.
        Specified by:
        getVersionable in interface FedoraDatastreamRecord

      • getHistory

        public List<FedoraDatastreamVersionRecord> getHistory()
        Returns a non-null, non-empty list of FedoraDatastreamVersionRecord objects representing the ordered history of this datastream from most recent to oldest.
        Specified by:
        getHistory in interface FedoraDatastreamRecord

      • getCurrentVersion

        public FedoraDatastreamVersionRecord getCurrentVersion()
        Gets the most recent version of the datastream. This method is just a shortcut for getHistory().get(0).
        Specified by:
        getCurrentVersion in interface FedoraDatastreamRecord
